text: Karrar Ibrahim (, 19 September 1994 – 9 July 2020) was an Iraqi footballer who played for Al-Talaba in the Iraqi Premier League. as a goalkeeper. ==Club career== Karrar started playing at Al-Minaa Club Academy. In 2009 he played with the first team in the Iraqi Premier League and continued until 2017 and then moved to the Naft Al-Junoob for one season, after which he returned to play for Al-Minaa in 2018 season. In 2019 he was dispensed with by coach Valeriu Tița and he moved to the ranks of the Al-Talaba club. ==International career== He represented Iraq at the 2016 AFC U-23 Championship.Karrar Ibrahim at Sofascore.com He was a reserve for the Iraq squad at the 2016 Summer Olympics.Olympedia ==Death== Karrar was found dead in his car on a street in Baghdad on 10 July 2020 after having a heart attack. ==References== ==External links== *Karrar Ibrahim at Fscore.org.uk Category:Iraqi footballers Category:1994 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Sportspeople from Basra Category:Al-Mina'a SC players Category:Naft Al-Janoob players Category:Association football goalkeepers Category:Footballers at the 2016 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic footballers of Iraq Category:Iraq youth international footballers
title: Karrar Ibrahim Hashim
